LanguageData.VRE_ManageGenelinesDesc: Change the currently selected geneline or create new genelines.
LanguageData.VRE_DeleteThisGeneline: Delete this geneline. Removing it will result in all insectors with this geneline immediately entering the metapod stage and turning into baseline insectors.
LanguageData.VRE_CreateGenelineExplanation: You can edit existing genelines or create a brand new geneline. Remember that changing a geneline will require your insectors to enter a metapod stage which will last 24 hours.
LanguageData.VRE_MessageConflictingGenesPresent: Cannot save geneline with multiple conflicting genes.
LanguageData.VRE_NeedEqualAmount: Needs equal amount of evolutions and degrades.
LanguageData.VRE_ChangingGenelineExplanation: Changing the genes of a geneline will cause all insectors that are a part of that geneline to enter the metapod stage. The metapod stage will last 24 hours, during which the insectors will be unavailable.
LanguageData.VRE_MetapodTimer: Time until {PAWN_nameDef} emerges: {1}\nInsert insect jelly into the metapod to speed up the process significantly.
LanguageData.VRE_MetapodSicknessCannotChangeGeneline: Cannot change genelines due to metapod sickness.
LanguageData.VRE_ChestburstPregnancyReadyDesc: When a colonist with chestburst pregnancy gene becomes pregnant, they need to designate another willing or unwilling individual to implant the fetus. Once the fetus matures, it will burst out of the ribcage of the victim, killing the host. If they don’t do it before the second trimester begins (6 days), the pregnancy will be terminated.
LanguageData.VRE_ChestburstImplantationNeededDesc: When a colonist with chestburst pregnancy gene becomes pregnant, they need to designate another willing or unwilling individual to implant the fetus. Once the fetus matures, it will burst out of the ribcage of the victim, killing the host. If they don’t do it before the second trimester begins (6 days), the pregnancy will be terminated. These colonists need to implant a fetus:\n\n{0}
LanguageData.VRE_InjectChestburstFetusDesc: Inject the victim with the fetus, which will burst out of the victim’s chest when mature, killing the host.
LanguageData.VRE_NeedsHumanoidOrAnimal: Needs to be injected on a humanoid target or adult animal with body size higher than 1
LanguageData.VRE_ChestburstBirth: A newborn, {0}, has hatched from a host, killing it in the process
LanguageData.VRE_SelfImpregnateDesc: Female individual self-impregnates, creating a fetus that’s a perfect copy of the parent.
LanguageData.VRE_OnlyOnSelf: Parthenogenesis can only be targeted on self
